data.title: Roadmap To Zero
data.meta_description: It's not possible to create big change alone, so we collaborate with others to get things done. That's the very core of our approach. Working alongside our contributors, partners and friends, our joint vision is clear. We want to reduce the environmental impact of fashion and footwear.
data.text:
Chief Operating Officer (COO)

Annie is responsible for driving operational excellence to support the growth of the organisation and building the day-to-day global operational structure and processes that are fundamental to bringing ZDHCâs strategic version to life, overseeing the financial, finance, human resource, and operational work, and managing the board governance of the organisation. After qualifying and practising as an environmental lawyer in the City of London, Annie moved to Nike Europe where she established the first environmental product and operations compliance programme. Her career at Nike developed into sustainable business and operations, capacity building programmes, community giving donation programmes for the donation of cash, products and employee time and skills. After 15 years at Nike, Annie joined TomTom as Corporate Social Responsibility Programme Director. There she developed and implemented a comprehensive strategy for corporate responsibility across social, environmental and community donations. Annie joined ZDHC in 2015. â

Quality Management & Assurance Director

Elisa is responsible for the organisation's overall quality framework by developing and implementing quality policies and procedures. With a focus on the ZDHC Guidelines, services and tolls and the work of 3rd party ZDHC Accepted Solution Providers. Prior to this role, Elisa was the Southern Europe Director at ZDHC responsible for the representation and implementation of the ZDHC Roadmap to Zero Programme in Italy, as well as in Spain and Portugal. Elisa has a Master's Degree in Environmental Science and a strong background in chemical product safety and management. Over the last 16 years, she has worked in different global positions for international service providers such as ICQ and UL, developing technical and managerial skills as well as the ability to interact with different stakeholders such as brands, manufacturers, governmental institutions and technical committees.

Chief Executive Officer (CEO)

As Chief Executive Director, Frank is responsible for strategic leadership and overseeing the activities of ZDHC. Frank is leading the implementation of ZDHCâs 2030 Impact Strategy and guides the international management in the roll-out of ZDHCâs Competence Centres, accelerating activities in regions, establishing quality assurance and due diligence infrastructure, and scaling the implementation of ZDHCâs Roadmap to Zero Programme in the Apparel & Footwear industry. Prior to joining ZDHC Frank was the Founder and Executive Director of a Europe-wide Non-Food Retail Association deeply involved in government and non-governmental liaison and stakeholder engagement. He has a deep understanding of how to generate effective value chain collaboration as well as process engineering and chemical management expertise in the FMCG sector. Frank has degrees from Universities in England and Germany in both business studies and modern European languages.

Collaborations Director

Taking the lead in collaboration of facility programmes between ZDHC and like-minded organisations and manages and accelerates the collaboration with the apparel alliance. Besides running the day-to-day operations, she is involved in developing strategies to advance the collaborations. Working closely with the rest of the team and contributors, all from varying walks of life, and from diverse backgrounds, driving the translation of the vision and strategy into concrete results. What Janne does, in research, goes into action in reality. With over a decade of experience at brands, prior to joining ZDHC, she worked at Mexx as the Quality, Trim & Colour Coordinator, G-Star RAW supporting where she supported the first Raw Organic Collections and moved later to Tommy Hilfiger (PVH) as a Quality Assurance and Technical Support Manager. Her last position before joining the team was the British Burberry, as part of Sustainable Manufacturing.

Implementation Director

Klaas is responsible for overseeing the implementation of the Roadmap to Zero Programme, stretching from the release management of ZDHC Guidelines to developing respective platforms and solutions to the rollout to the ZDHC communities. Klaasâs team also manages the Adoption Tools; Supplier to Zero and Brands to Zero Leader Programmes and drives sector engagement to build and maintain relationships with our stakeholders. Klaas has a strong track record in social and environmental sustainability.

Regions Director

Lydia is responsible for accelerating the adoption and implementation of the Roadmap to Zero Programme in the main production countries and leading the activities of all ZDHC regions (currently East Asia, South Asia and Southern Europe). She is driving the growth of regional programme implementation by developing and executing effective strategies and working closely with regional representatives. Prior to this current global region's role, Lydia was responsible for leading the development and expansion of the ZDHC Programme in East Asia. Lydia worked as a Senior Environmental Chemist at C&A for four years, where she first got to know the ZDHC Programme, as one of her responsibilities was to take the lead role within the Far East and maintain the relationship with the ZDHC Programme. Lydia is based in Shanghai and has a degree in Textile Machinery from Donghua University.

Business Operations Director

Nina manages the Platforms & Data and the Global Customer Support Team. In addition, Nina ensures all departmental and individual objectives are set realistically and have the necessary structure, resources and budget allocated to drive the successful and efficient delivery of ZDHCâs business goals and milestones. Prior to joining ZDHC, Nina worked at Rainforest Alliance, where she held several positions, such as supervisor of the customer success team, project manager for digital solutions and innovation manager for process improvements and new business models. She holds a Master's Degree in Politics and Economy of the Middle East and has a background in design thinking and lean and agile management.

Competence Centres Director

As Competence Centres Director, Prasad is responsible for the development, implementation, and management of four Competence Centres for Sustainable Chemical Management, Water Stewardship, Air (Emissions & GreenHouseGas) and Fibres & Materials. Prasad manages Subject Matter Experts who provide thought leadership and technical solutions to propose new guidelines and lead the updates of existing ZDHC Guidelines by fostering scalable innovations and collaborations. Prior to this role, Prasad was the South Asia Director at ZDHC with a focus on stakeholder engagement to increase awareness of ZDHC approaches, workshops and roadshows on the ZDHC tools and standards as well as tailored implementation support. Prasad has a degree in Textile Chemistry and 28 years of experience in textile processing, dyes & auxiliaries manufacturing & marketing and chemical management systems implementation. He has worked with chemical companies such as IDI, Ciba and Atul. Prasad has also developed training modules and worked on chemical management projects with several apparel brands & retailers in his assignment at NimkarTek. Prasad is based for ZDHC in Mumbai.

Chief Impact Officer (CIO)

As Chief Impact Officer Scott, is coordinating all focus areas and driving programme delivery. He works to connect the ZDHC Foundation and build a community of North American-based signatories, stakeholders, and like-minded organisations to further research and discovery processes to evaluate the impact of sustainable chemicals management and promote sustainable innovations. These areas include research into novel methods to monitor the impacts of chemical use on water, biodiversity, and climate change, as well as collaborating with researchers in green chemistry and the textile industry to evaluate new methods of making such as 3D printing and digital coloration. Scott is an expert in sustainable materials and processes for the apparel and footwear industries. He has 35 years of experience in environmental chemistry and over 20 years of experience in textile and footwear product chemistry issues. Scott was part of the Nike Materials Science Innovation group and was the Environmental Manager for C&A Europe. Scott is based in North Carolina and holds a B.S and M.S degrees in Chemistry and an M.S. degree in Textile Chemistry.â

Marketing & Events Manager

Alisa manages and interacts with the internal and external audience to deliver the organisationâs messages to the public and media. She develops and implements the marketing and communications strategy, including the ensuring of brand consistency among all materials and channels. Alisa manages the publications and website, facilitates marketing campaigns for ZDHC tools and helps to plan events. Prior to joining ZDHC, Alisa worked for brasi&brasi GmbH, where she managed the Customer Relationship Management and also the Internal Communication. Alisa holds a degree in Global Brand and Fashion Management with a major in communications from the International School of Management in Frankfurt/Germany.

Senior Communications Project Management Associate

Andrew supports the development and implementation of the communication team goals and strategies by overseeing all incoming traffic and requests for the department and working directly with the creative producer and internal communications specialist to plan the year, weeks, and months and support priority projects. He also coordinates all ZDHC newsletters. Before joining ZDHC, Andrew served as an Americorps VISTA in Montana, helping rural communities adapt to the climate crisis. Prior to that, he worked as a student assistant at the German Marshall fund. Andrew has a Bachelor of Arts in History with a focus on the Atlantic World and a Masterâs degree in British Studies from Humboldt-UniversitÃ¤t with a focus on project management and contract law.

Footwear Engagement Director

Andy leads efforts within the footwear sector at ZDHC. His responsibilities include analysing the industry, developing strategic plans, and engaging with stakeholders both inside and outside the organisation. Andy holds a PhD in Chemistry and brings 20 years of experience at Nike, where he developed the global Restricted Substance List (RSL) and led the implementation of product chemistry protocols for material suppliers and manufacturers. Furthermore, he was at the helm of implementing the ZDHC MRSL for Nike and its affiliates.

Senior Customer Support Associate

Asawari Puranik is responsible for managing all customer queries related to ZDHC guidelines, platforms and services and is making sure the ZDHC Knowledge Base is up to date. Asawari completed her masters degree in Textiles and Clothing (Home Science) from Mumbai University and then worked in Texanlab Laboratories Pvt. Ltd., wherein she performed various physical and colour fastness tests on fibres, yarns, fabrics, garments and home textiles for 5 years. Later, she moved to a customer coordination position in TLPL wherein she was the key account person for buyers such as Ikea and Levis. She was responsible for offline training programs for Indian suppliers for physical and colour fastness tests and helped suppliers to understand buyer's requirements. In total, she is having 15 years of experience in the textile industry.

Senior Communications Associate

Ashley is based in Amsterdam/The Netherlands, and as a Senior Communications Associate, she is responsible for all ZDHC event-related communications and marketing activities. As well as driving media and thought leadership to amplify and shape the conversations of the sector through storytelling and narrative building. Before ZDHC, Ashley was the communication coordinator at the European Cultural Foundation, leading communications activities from events to storytelling around grantees. Ashley has previously worked at Metabolic, a consulting agency offering a systemic approach to sustainability, and she has also campaigned for the Sustainable Development Goals. With her experience in sustainability and European cultural affairs combined with her academic background in Mass Media and communications with a minor in Journalism at Stetson University, she understands the importance of translating complex messages into accessible and engaging language.

Data Innovation Business Developer

Barbara spearheads the development of the ZDHC Product Passport Traceability and Transparency Strategy 2030 and establishes strategic partnerships to innovate data collection and collaboration solutions. With over 15 years of experience in business development and innovation, Barbara has led transformational projects across sectors including e-waste, water and sanitation, carbon offsetting, data traceability, and more. She has previously held key roles at Rainforest Alliance, MDF Training & Consultancy, and the European Design Centre. Barbara holds a degree in Communication and Marketing from Universidade CatÃ³lica Portuguesa and a certificate in New Business Development from Erasmus University in Rotterdam. She is fluent in Portuguese, English, and Dutch, bringing a wealth of expertise in sustainability, strategy development, and creative problem-solving.

Implementation Hub Manager

Claudia contributes to the evolution and implementation of the ZDHC Academy strategy and workplan. She is involved in capacity building projects and works closely with both internal and external Academy stakeholders on the coordination and implementation of the projects, as well as on training content development and general Academy related topics. Before joining the ZDHC Foundation, Claudia worked at a fashion brand as Sustainability Project Manager where she managed a variety of environmental focused projects.

Stakeholder Manager

Cristina is based in Frankfurt/Germany, and as Stakeholder Manager, she organises and monitors the administrative, legal and financial relationships with our Signatories. Further, she manages the onboarding of new Signatories from the first touch point for interested potential partners to integrate them into the ZDHC Programme. Prior to joining ZDHC, Cristina worked for 17 years for a multi-stakeholder organisation where she managed labour and human resources as well as environmental topics. Cristina has a Master's degree in Economics from the University of Frankfurt and a Master of Arts in âEuropean Politics and European Legal Studiesâ from the Europa-Kolleg Hamburg.

Sector Engagement Manager

As a Sector Engagement Manager, Dina is responsible for building and maintaining relations with sector groups engaging in the Roadmap to Zero Programme: Brands, Chemical Companies, Manufacturer Suppliers, and Solution Providers. In her role, Dina facilitates discussions in Advisory Groups, ensuring everyoneâs voice is heard and answered. She also manages the Find Your Expert Platform and helps scale up the usage of the ZDHC MRSL SCM framework. Before ZDHC, Dina worked at Novozymes, building awareness about sustainable chemical alternatives in textile wet processing.

Customer Support Associate

Dipali Thakur works as Customer Support Associate at ZDHC and is based out of the India Office. She has done her Masters in Textiles and Clothing and has previous work experience with Texanlab and Unisource group as a textile testing executive responsible for the physical and colour fastness tests. Dipali manages all customer queries related to ZDHC guidelines, platforms and services and supports the ZDHC Knowledge Base in terms of articles and keeping it up-to- date.

Human Resources Manager

As the Human Resources Manager at ZDHC Foundation, Elisangela plays a pivotal role in shaping and managing our HR strategies with a strong emphasis on Performance Management and Talent Development. She ensures that our organisationâs expanding needs are met with efficient HR services, robust policies, and innovative programs. Elisangela is a dedicated Global HR Manager with experience across international environment. Prior to joining ZDHC, Elisangela built a respected career in global talent management, serving in pivotal roles at renowned companies including Next Venture, Jack Links, Nike, The Art of Vision Publisher, Foot Locker, and Braziltours. Her diverse and multifaceted background provide her with the unique insights and expertise needed to support our global HR initiatives with excellence.

Customer Support & Regions Associate

Elsa Liu works as a Customer Support & Regions Associate and is based in China. She is responsible for assisting Chinese-speaking customers with their inquiries related to the ZDHC Roadmap to Zero Programme, platforms, and services and translating the articles on the ZDHC Knowledge Base to Chinese to keep them up-to-date. In addition, she will also be involved in supporting the Regions Director with regional organisational and administrative tasks and plays a vital role in supporting various aspects of the regionâs operations. Elsa Liu holds a Bachelorâs degree in English. Before joining ZDHC, Elsa Liu worked for more than three years for ADEC Innovations where she served as the Gateway CS Manager (China). She is familiar with supporting customers and working as a bridge between the customers and the team, communicating with the technical team or management team to find solutions to problems encountered by the customers.

Business Enablement Manager

Eniko leads the Business Enablement team that supports and equips the organisation by driving effective strategies and initiatives that optimise operations and promote growth. Eniko works closely with the Executive Management on various matters such as strategic development, stakeholder engagement and process improvement. She collaborates with team members to identify opportunities, implement solutions, and ensure the smooth execution of business objectives. Her main focus is on Impact Analysis and Strategic Reporting. She participates in strategic discussions with internal and external stakeholders and provides the Executive Management and ZDHC Board with analytics and insights on strategic development on a regular basis. Eniko holds a Bachelorâs degree in Civil Engineering and prior to joining ZDHC, she worked as a representative of the Danish Engineering Society, IDA. She is involved with various volunteering organisations to contribute to both society and the environment.

Implementation Manager

Francesca contributes to the global implementation and evolution of the ZDHC Roadmap to Zero Programme and key projects across the value chain. She manages the ZDHC Leader Programmes for Brands and Suppliers, enabling the implementation of ZDHC-related strategies. Francescaâs expertise relies on a blend of engineering studies, academic research and working experience in the fashion industry. She previously worked at a fashion group, managing its MRSL programme and various sustainability projects.

Business Model Strategist

Business Model Strategy is crucial for designing and executing innovative transactional business models for ZDHC's stakeholders, ensuring smooth implementation and scalability. Gian will focus on signatory brands, solution providers, chemical formulators, and manufacturers, creating sustainable financial engagements and leveraging ZDHC's tools while maintaining existing contributions. Engaging in strategic discussions, he aims to align goals to drive income generation, market uptake, and the growth of new business models, advancing ZDHCâs mission and positively impacting the textile and apparel industry. His commercial experience includes leading operational and sales strategies that create value for stakeholders, and collaborating with multifunctional teams to identify opportunities for added value and revenue.

Technical Writer

As Technical Writer, Helen is responsible for supporting the Subject Matter Experts in creating guidelines, knowledge base articles, newsletters and other communications. Providing a clear, consistent voice across all, ensuring the content is received by the target audience. Before joining ZDHC, Helen worked for brands and suppliers for over 15 years. Starting as a garment technologist, later moving to footwear and accessories, and finally stepping into chemical compliance. Most recently, Helen worked as Senior Compliance Technologist at ASOS, leading their chemical management strategy.

Technical Manager - Air Competence Centre

As Technical Manager in ZDHCâs Air Competence Centre, Jaswant is involved in developing ZDHCâs guidelines on air and GHG emissions within the apparel and footwear sector. With a strong background in GHG accounting, product carbon footprint, life cycle analysis, sustainability reporting, and decarbonisation, Jaswant will lead ZDHCâs work in connecting chemistry to climate change impacts and resource efficiency framework. Jaswant is a qualified chemical engineer and has a post-graduation in energy management. He has worked with textile manufacturers and a leading apparel brand in their sustainability departments, due to which he has a good understanding of textile operations and chemical management. He is based in India.

Data & Business Analyst

As Data & Business Analyst, JosÃ© is involved in the definition and implementation of the data strategy of ZDHC, in conducting data analysis and impact reporting and in driving continuous process improvements, while promoting the quality of information and the value of the same for stakeholders. JosÃ© brings the experience from several years working at Bluwin\Sustainable Textile Solutions, where he was Business Analyst and, later, Global Controlling & Business Lead. In these roles he was involved in the implementation of sustainability projects for some of the main brands of the textile industry. JosÃ© studied Information Management at the Faculty of Engineering - Porto University, in Portugal.

Financial Controller

Jose is the ZDHC Foundation's Financial Controller, responsible for managing accounting records, evaluating and managing risk, ensuring compliance with financial regulations, publishing financial statements, and overseeing accounting operations. He analyses financial data, monitors expenditure, forecasts revenue, coordinates auditing processes, and ensures the accuracy of all financial information. Jose also plays a role in budgeting, implementing internal controls, organizational targets, and developing financial plans that support our organizational strategy. JosÃ© has a substantial track record of managing, preparing, and analysing financial reports and budgets for a number of international corporations, such as Siemens, Exel Freight Management, JLG, and Getronics, prior to joining the ZDHC Foundation. JosÃ© studied accounting at the Institute Vaz de Camoes in Lisbon, Portugal, and has a Bachelor of Business Administration (IBMS) from the (HES) Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences.

Administration Associate

Jyoti provides support on administrative, HR and finance-related matters. She manages documentation tasks and ensures compliance on matters related to the India entity of ZDHC. In addition, she plays an integral role in supporting the Competence Centres Team for project management and the South Asia Regional team for event management. Jyoti has a bachelors in Business Management and has 11 years of experience in accounts and finance.

Senior Gateway Platform Associate

Katya leads the ZDHC Gateway communications strategy and manages incoming feedback to continuously improve the user experience of the ZDHC Gateway. She coordinates platform development projects, creates onboarding and training material for ZDHC Signatories and Gateway users, and organises ZDHC Platforms events. Before joining ZDHC Katya worked at Fashion for Good, and holds a degree in International Business. Her experience lies in communications, business development and facilitation of consumer behaviour change across different fields, from the tech industry to sustainable food to sustainable fashion, first as a generalist and later diving deeper into the dyeing and finishing part of the textile supply chain.

Human Resources Associate

As a Human Resources Associate and a dedicated Law Student, Lesley-Anne manages and maintains our human resources records with precision and care. She is responsible for obtaining and recording HR information, managing the HR database, and assisting staff with enrollment procedures and HR-related issues, ensuring smooth and efficient HR operations. In her role, Lesley-Anne combines her legal knowledge with her HR expertise to support our organisationâs needs, fostering a compliant and supportive work environment.

Country Manager - Brazil

As the country manager for Brazil, Marcelo Lobo occupies a pivotal role in advancing sustainable chemical management practices, providing essential support to ZDHC's signatory Brands & Friends and the broader value chain. With a background in chemical engineering and a postgraduate qualification in quality technology, Marcelo brings over three decades of diverse experience, spanning private-label vertical production, the chemical industry, and retail. His profound expertise and unwavering passion serve as indispensable assets in ZDHC's mission for transformative systemic change.

Senior Roadmap to Zero Delivery Project Associate

Marina is responsible for managing and coordinating multiple ZDHC projects from the start to the end, such as ZDHC Guideline releases and corresponding platform functionality adjustments. This includes coordinating and maintaining project briefs, timelines, tracking and reporting statuses, coordinating task teams and its specific documentation and keeping internal and external stakeholders informed on their responsibilities and on the statuses of the projects. She is also responsible for documenting processes and procedures, while continuously improving processes and project management practices. Prior to this role, Marina worked at ZDHC as an Office and Business Operations for 3 years and worked as an Office and Operations Manager for different startups in Amsterdam, and also ran her own Business English initiative in Brazil.

Office & Business Operations

Marina is responsible for delivering safe, healthy, and smoothly operated workplaces for the ZDHC global workforce. She also coordinates internal events and community-building activities. Working closely with the management team, Marina carefully monitors areas of improvement and acts to successfully execute them. Prior to joining ZDHC, Marina worked in the fast-moving consumer goods industry for 7 years in Brazil and The Netherlands. She holds a bachelor's degree in Nutrition Science, a Master's degree in Marketing, and a Fashion Business Diploma.

Implementation Associate

As part of the Implementation team, Matilde contributes to driving forward ongoing initiatives, such as the MMCF programme and DMFa project. She is responsible for maintaining and enhancing strategic partnerships with key stakeholders, while also providing support in various engagement strategies in close collaboration with regional teams. Before joining ZDHC, Matilde gathered experience in the field of international development, focusing on circular economy and climate initiatives in the textile sector while pursuing her Masterâs in Sustainability Sciences in Germany. Her earlier career involved coordinating the conceptualisation and implementation of an environmental education programme focused on Biomimicry across three Latin American countries. Lastly, through her background in Design, Matilde has worked in various capacities within the fashion and textile industry, including the development of small-scale fibre innovation projects in Colombia.

Implementation Manager

âPhilip handles the development of the Supplier to Zero Programme and the ZDHC Academy. In his previous role at the ZDHC Foundation, he turned Focus Areas and Task Team concepts into deliverables. Philip has also been part of SGS, where he worked on the ZDHC and Detox initiatives.

Technical Manager - SCM Competence Centre

As Technical Manager for Sustainable Chemical Management, Pushkar leverages his technical expertise to review, update, and develop guidelines for the ZDHC MRSL Framework. He also oversees the implementation of the framework within the chemical industry to ensure compliance with ZDHC MRSL standards. Pushkar takes an active role in engaging and managing stakeholder groups such as the ZDHC Task Teams, Advisory Groups, and MRSL Council, fostering effective communication and alignment around the ZDHC MRSL SCM Framework. Additionally, he supports innovative sustainable chemistry technologies and collaborates with the ZDHC Academy to develop new training modules focused on sustainable chemical management. Pushkar possesses extensive knowledge in organic chemistry, analytical chemistry, and chemical synthesis processes, with over 15 years of experience across various organisations. He holds a Ph.D. in Organic Chemistry from the USA, and has conducted post-doctoral research in the field of green chemistry in Japan.

Senior Marketing & Communications Manager

Razvan leads ZDHC's Marketing and Communications team, overseeing the delivery of high-impact omnichannel content and the execution of integrated communication programs across internal and external channels. His focus is professionalising and elevating our communication outputs, aligning with our vision and programmes. Razvan has over 20 years of global experience across various corporate communications and public affairs disciplines, shaping narratives and influencing policy across several regulated sectors. Before ZDHC, Razvan held different market, regional and global roles at Accor Services, JTI, emerging fintech scaleups and Elsevier, a global scientific publishing leader. Razvan holds a Master's Degree in Political Science and a Bachelor's in Juridical Sciences and joined ZDHC in 2024.

Implementation Manager - South Asia Region

As Implementation Manager, Saket will handle the implementation and monitoring of ZDHC Roadmap to Zero Programme in the South Asia region. In his role, Saket will manage customer queries, oversee implementation projects with supply chain partners, liaise with industry stakeholders, and help to organise awareness workshops and regional events to accelerate the adoption of ZDHC. Saket is based in Mumbai, India. Saket has completed Masters in Technology in Textile Processing and has 7 years of experience in testing, chemical management, and eco-certifications. Saket has developed and implemented chemical management policy at Arvind Ltd. and also worked on Life Cycle Assessment projects. Prior to joining ZDHC, Saket worked for Hohenstein India and was managing Eco-Passport certifications for India and conducting ZDHC MRSL Level 3 audits.

Senior Implementation Manager - East Asia Region

As Implementation Manager, Shinne Li focuses on the ZDHC implementation in the Chemical industry and Leather industry in East Asia and is based in Shanghai. Prior to joining ZDHC, Shinne worked for Li & Fung as Detox Manager to implement Chemical Management in Home Textile, Apparel and Footwear industries. Before that, Shinne had roles as Programme Manager of Chemical Assessment and Technical Manager of Chemical Management in Intertek. Shinne also had rich chemical experience and worked for BASF. Shinne is a Senior Engineer and has a degree in Leather Engineering from Shaanxi University of Science & Technology.

Country Manager-TÃ¼rkiye

Sinem is the Country Manager for regional operations in TÃ¼rkiye, driving widespread adoption and use of ZDHC guidelines/platforms/services as well as organizing local stakeholder engagement. She is the primary liasion with stakeholders in TÃ¼rkiye, including in-depth market research into the local value chain, overseeing the planning and execution of ZDHC events for local stakeholders, and engaging with the wider external community.

Technical Manager - Fibres & Materials Competence Centre

Smita is a Subject Matter Expert in the Fibres & Materials Competence Centre of the ZDHC Roadmap to Zero Programme. She is responsible for developing the Fibres and Circularity Strategy and creating and updating industry guidelines for various fibres and materials. She supports ZDHCâs collaborative efforts while also researching innovations in new, sustainable fibres and recycled materials. She is involved in developing training materials and ZDHC digital tools related to sustainable fibres and circular economy. Smita completed her Doctorate degree in Fibres and Textile Processing Technology from the Institute of Chemical Technology, India. She has over 13 years of work experience with the Wool Research Association (WRA), India, where she designed and managed R&D projects sponsored by various government agencies in the field of advanced textile processing technology, effluent treatment processes, CCM technology etc. Smita has experience in eco-testing and was the Internal Auditor at WRA. She is based in Mumbai, India.

Programme and Solution Quality Assurance Manager

Stefania works in collaboration with the ZDHC Roadmap to Zero Programme and Implementation HUB teams to guarantee the quality and consistency of ZDHC deliverables regarding platforms, tools and solutions across the organisation. She is involved in ensuring quality and establishment and consistency of data and services delivered by external third-party organisations within the framework of the implementation of the ZDHC Roadmap to Zero Programme and Implementation HUB. Stefania holds a Degree in Chemistry and brings 8 years of experience in the Textile&Leather Sector, where she mainly has covered the role of Sustainability Manager, trainer and Auditor for many schemes specific for textile and leather both for product and process (in the fields of Chemical Management, Environment, Quality Management, Social Responsibility and Health and Safety). She was a trainer approved by ZDHC. Stefania had also experience in textile and environmental laboratories, both in regards of tests performed and quality management system following ISO/IEC 17025 Standard, for which she was the responsible person.

Technical Manager- Water Competence Centre

Tejas will be incharge of providing technical support from the ZDHC water stewardship competence centre on all wastewater, waste disposal, and water use issues, with a focus on textile, leather, and footwear industries. He will work on behalf of ZDHC with stakeholders, technical experts, like-minded organizations, academia, and training institutions outside the ZDHC community on all water competency centre activities. Tejas currently resides in Mumbai, India. He holds Bachelor's degree in Textile Technology from University of Mumbai as well as Master's degree in Textile Management. He has over ten years of industrial experience.

Technical Associate - SCM Competence Centre

As a Technical Expert, Umesh will be responsible for providing technical expert support to all functions relating to the Roadmap to Zero Programme. He will be instrumental in supporting the coordination of global implementation projects. Based in Mumbai, Umesh studied at the Institute of Chemical Technology, India, to obtain a Doctorate degree in Fibres and Textile Processing Technology and specialises in polymer synthesis and characterisation, surfactant and textile auxiliary evaluation, textile wet processing application procedures, and the set-up of chemical database systems. Additionally, Umesh has taught academically in different areas of textile wet processing, and facilitated research projects.

Systems & Solutions Manager

Valentin manages the Digital Project Process and overall roadmap of ZDHC digital platforms and modules and leads the alignment between technology solution providers(s) and Subject Matter Experts to make sure the ZDHC Roadmap to Zero Programme users are experiencing a smooth and efficient user journey in our digital ecosystem. Prior to joining ZDHC, Valentinâs work was to implement the assessment of social auditors and online trainings for AQM, performing some social audits around Bangladesh, China and Cambodia himself. Valentin holds an engineering degree specialised in technical textiles and advanced materials from ENSAIT, Europeâs leading textile engineering school in Roubaix, France.

Senior Product Manager

As the Senior Product Manager, Vanessa provides strategic direction and leadership in the development and management of the ZDHC Gateway and oversees the entire lifecycle of the ZDHC Gateway, from conception to launch and beyond. Prior to joining ZDHC, Vanessa worked for CHT Germany GmbH in the Jeans & Garment Department as a Technical Service Engineer. In her role she was responsible for application-specific consultation, especially regarding eco friendly bleaching concepts. Vanessa holds a Master Degree in Textile Products - Textile and Clothing Technology from the Hochschule Niederrhein - University of Applied Sciences.

Senior Legal Counsel

Victoria is responsible for managing the legal affairs of the ZDHC Group, providing legal advice and guidance to staff members and senior management on a wide range of legal matters including contracts negotiation, regulatory compliance, and intellectual property. She oversees the organisation's legal affairs, and is responsible for drafting, reviewing, and negotiating contracts and agreements with third parties. Victoria develops and implements policies and procedures to ensure compliance with applicable laws, ultimately ensuring that the organisation minimises its legal risks. Victoria holds master degrees in International Environmental Law and Natural Resources Law from La Sorbonne University in Paris and from the University of Iceland.
